Package application

Class Control

java.lang.Object
application.Control
public class Control extends Object
This method is what's used to fufill all the different actions the user tries to do with the UI. It handles all the dirty details like logic and calling other classes so that the UI code is simple.
Author:
william

  • Method Details

    • createAccount

      public boolean createAccount(String username, String password)
      Allows the user to make an account.
      Parameters:
      username - the username for the account.
      password - the password for the account.
      Returns:
      Returns true if the account was succesfully created, returns false if a user with the given username already existed.

    • login

      public boolean login(String username, String password)
      Lets the user login and set the current teacher.
      Parameters:
      username - The Username of the user trying to login.
      password - The password for that account.
      Returns:
      Returns true if login succeeded, returns false if no account was found with matching info or if password is incorrect.

    • createClass

      public void createClass(String className)
      Creates a new class for the teacher currently logged in.
      Parameters:
      className - the name of the class that the user is making.

    • createStudent

      public void createStudent(String name)
      This creates a new student for the current class and adds it to the class's student list, and then sets the current student to be this newly created student.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the new student being added.

    • createAssignment

      public void createAssignment(String name)
      This creates a new assignment and adds them the current classes assignment list, and then sets the current assignment to be this new one so it can be quickly updated with info.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the new student being added.

    • viewClasses

      public TreeMap<String,ClassRoster> viewClasses()
      Returns the list of classes for display.
      Returns:
      returns a string of the classes available.

    • viewStudentList

      public String viewStudentList()
      Displays the different students that have been made for the current class.
      Returns:
      Returns a string containing the set of students and their names.

    • viewStudent

      public String viewStudent(String studentName)
      Gathers all the information pertaining to the specified student, and puts it together into a string to display.
      Parameters:
      studentName - The name of the student whose information you're gathering.
      Returns:
      Returns the string containing all the information for the specified student.

    • viewAssignmentList

      public String viewAssignmentList()
      Displays the different assignments that have been made for the current class.
      Returns:

    • viewAssignment

      public String viewAssignment(String assignmentName)
      This gathers all the information pertaining to the specified assignment, and puts it together into a single string.
      Parameters:
      assignmentName - The name of the assignment that your getting the data for.
      Returns:
      The string to be displayed.

    • editStudent

      public void editStudent(String oldName, String newName, String notes, int absenses)
      Edits the information on the current student by deleting the old student object and creating a new one in the case that the name changes and then sets the information for the new student object.
      Parameters:
      oldName - The original name of the student whose information your
      newName - The new name of the student whose information your
      notes - The notes that you wish to be saved for the student.
      absenses - the number of absences you wish for this student to have.

    • editAssignment

      public void editAssignment(String oldName, String newName, String description, String type, int maxPoints, String dueDate)
      Edits the information on the current assignment by deleting the old assignment object and creating a new one in case the name changes, and then sets the information for the new assignment object.
      Parameters:
      oldName - The old name of the assignment being edited.
      newName - The new name of the assignment.
      description - The new description of the object.
      type - The new type (homework, quiz, test, final) of the
      maxPoints - The new maximum number of points that can be earned.
      dueDate - The new due date for the assignment.

    • deleteStudent

      public void deleteStudent(String name)
      Uses the deleteStudent function in the ClassRoster class to delete a student with the specified name.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the student that you're deleting.

    • deleteAssignment

      public void deleteAssignment(String name)
      Uses the delete assignment function in the ClassRoster class to delete an assignment.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the assignment that you're deleting.

    • deleteClass

      public void deleteClass(String name)
      Deletes the specified class from the current teacher's class list.

    • generateID

      public String generateID(char typeLetter, int previousID)
      generates a unique ID for identification that won't be changed.
      Parameters:
      typeLetter - the type of object, ID's for objects of the same type will all begin with the same letter.
      previousID - the ID for the most recent object needs to be passed in to ensure that this objects ID is unique and an increase from the last one.
      Returns:
      returns the ID that was generated.
